info.name: Marble Maneuvers
info.attribution:
History logging technique developed by Johnathan Cox. All other layout, design, and library image by LawDawg96. Released to the Public Domain under CC0.

Wood grain background by RyanPro available under the Pixabay license from https://pixabay.com/photos/trees-wood-yellow-wood-oak-1915247/
info.description: Move a marble to capture an adjacent marble. Score both for your own marbles and those of the player counter-clockwise next to you.
info.ruleText:
Players sit in seats. Click the restart button to begin the game. A random player is chosen to start.

Drag the black marble onto an adjacent marble you want to collect. It will mov to your seat area automatically. The turn also automatically passes to the next player counter-clockwise.

The game ends when the black marble is isolated and cannot be moved into an area with another marble.

Press the score button to calculate scores. You get 10 points for each white marble collected. You get the square of the number of each of the other groups of colored marbles collected. For example, a player with 2 white (20 points), 2 pink (2 points), and 6 blue (36 points) stones gets 58 points.

If playing with more than 2 players, then each player gets added to their score the value of the marbles collected by the player next to them counter-clockwise. Therefore, there is a strategic element to the game in helping the player that goes after you. This score calculation is also handled by pressing the score button and is noted in the history log.

The player with the highest score wins. In the event of a tie, the player with the highest score based on their own collected marbles wins.
